instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> missing PPBUS 0.3v
threads.message:
This had liquid damage , was cleaned in ULSONIC , get green light 
on the charger , PPBUS is 0.1-0.3 v , no short on PPPBUS.
when injecting 8.6v to PPBUS the board does turn on and 
fan spin .
assume missing PPBUS, all PPBUS looks clean .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> missing PPBUS 0.3v
threads.message: Resistance between pins 17/18 and 27/28 of the <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>? Where was original corrosion?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> missing PPBUS 0.3v
threads.message:
Yes was corroded .
I will post result tomorrow !!
thank you again
